item.title: ConnectFour
item.description: This program touches on networking. It lets two players play a game of ConnectFour while the program keeps track of the baord. The server and client was setup as follows: public ConnectFourServer(int port) throws IOException { server = new ServerSocket(port); //connections for both players s1 = server.accept(); s2 = server.accept(); //input and output streams for both out1 = new PrintStream(s1.getOutputStream()); in1 = new Scanner(s1.getInputStream()); out2 = new PrintStream(s2.getOutputStream()); in2 = new Scanner(s2.

item.title: Functions
item.description: This project deals with Calculus expressions. The program is designed to solve certain type of problems. The abstract class, Function.java was used as a template for math objects such as a sum, project, cosine, variable, etc. : public abstract class Function { /** * Create a function */ public Function() { } public abstract double evaluate(double x); public abstract String toString(); public abstract Function derivative(); public abstract double integral(double a, double b, int c); public abstract boolean isConstant(); } One of the more difficult parts of this was implementing the derivative function of a Product object.

item.title: Derp Interpretor
item.description: This exercise was used to evaluate simple mathematical expressions that were represented by a tree. The following classes were used to help make the tree: @dataclass class LiteralNode: """Represents an operand node""" val: int @dataclass class VariableNode: """Represents a variable node""" name: str @dataclass class MathNode: """Represents a mathematical operation""" left: Union['MathNode', LiteralNode, VariableNode] op: str right: Union['MathNode', LiteralNode, VariableNode] @dataclass class table: """ used to store variables with their value """ key: str value: str Using those, a method was made to solve the equations:

item.title: Roots
item.description: This is one of the earliest programming exercises I had worked on: Given 3 parameters, a function would return how many roots an equation had and what they were. Sample Code: def quadratic_roots(a, b, c): """ This function will take the discriminant and use it to see how many roots exist for the equation. It then finds what the roots are. The a, b, c variables pertain to the a,b,c in the equation ax^2 + bx + c.

item.title: Why?
item.description: Started practicing this in my first year of college to better apreciate music. I figured if I learned a musical instrument, I would be able to understand beats/rhytmn more and how they work together.

item.title: Intro
item.description: Hey, I’m Zaarib and currenty studying Software Engineering at RIT. I go by several names which include, Mitchel, Samin, and of course Zaarib (long story). I am also a crazy Travis Scott and Kanye West fan and am thoroughly addcited to music.
